info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 5 at 7:31AM EDT until August 5 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Gaston.
* WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 729 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain has occurred in this area. Minor flooding is possible at Catawba Creek at East Hudson Blvd. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gastonia, Mt Holly, Belmont, South Gastonia, Cramerton, Lowell, Ranlo, Mcadenville, Crowders Mountain State Park, Lake Wylie and Crowders. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
